faqs.question: Is pet insurance worth it for a Shiba Inu?
faqs.answer: Yes. Shibas commonly face allergies, joint problems, and eye conditions. Insurance helps manage these hereditary and chronic issues.

faqs.question: Do Shiba Inus have allergy problems?
faqs.answer: Yes—skin and food allergies are common. Symptoms include itching, licking, and skin infections. Treatment often involves lifelong medication or special diets.

faqs.question: Are Shiba Inus healthy dogs?
faqs.answer: Generally healthier than many breeds, but their popularity has led to poor breeding practices. Buy from health-tested breeders to reduce risk.

faqs.question: What eye problems do Shibas get?
faqs.answer: Glaucoma and cataracts both occur in the breed. Regular eye exams help catch issues early. Both may require surgery.

faqs.question: How long do Shiba Inus live?
faqs.answer: 13-16 years typically—longer than many breeds. Their longevity makes managing chronic conditions important.
